item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 2127 Beatties Ford Road in Charlotte, North Carolina, as the "Jim Richardson Post Office".

item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4559)
For further action, see H.R. 1505, which became Public Law 108-17 on 4/23/2003.

summary.text: Designates the building that houses the operations of the University Park United States Postal Service located at 2127 Beattys Ford Road, in Charlotte, North Carolina (or any other building to which such Postal Service may relocate after the enactment of this Act) as the Jim Richardson Post Office Building.

bill.title: A bill to designate a building that houses the operations of the University Park United States Postal Service in Charlotte, North Carolina, as the "Jim Richardson Post Office Building".

item.title: A bill to designate a building that houses the operations of the University Park United States Postal Service in Charlotte, North Carolina, as the "Jim Richardson Post Office Building".
A bill to designate a building that houses the operations of the University Park United States Postal Service in Charlotte, North Carolina, as the "Jim Richardson Post Office Building".

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4559)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
